reviews.review_msg: She is one of the best professors I have had at SFU. She is very respectful, very insightful and knows what she is talking about. I am sad that it is my last semester and I won't be able to take anymore classes with her.
Wonderful professor, enthusiastic lectures, really knowledgable and helpful in her area of study (communications and politics) one of my favorite classes taken in my degree

Man, I just love Alicia so much. Ever since this pandemic started, teachers just do not care about putting effort into making online school engaging. I had a 4 hour lecture with her and they were so compact with fun activities and discussions that the 4 hours just flew by. She is incredibly kind and personable, ugh just a wonderful human.

hands down one of my favourite professors at SFU. The class was also one of the few realistic, applicable classes within the CMNS degree. It was difficult in terms of learning new concepts and actually diving into political conversations that I never usually engage in. Readings were engaging and weren't just from old journal articles.

Avoid taking this class with Mirjam if you can!! Her assignment criteria is not clear, the course readings were extremely outdated  and the lectures were not informative. Although she is accessible outside of class I found it to be way below expectations and a disappointment for a 4th year class.
